paper_title.ja: 中学校理科における観察 : 実験項目に対する学習者の認識
paper_title.en: The Learner's Cognition about Each of Observations and Experiments in Junior High School Science Study

description.ja: We have argued with regard to the role of observations and experiments in science study in terms of utility, limits, and so on. In general, we recognize the importance of observations and experiments in science study. Until now, we have neglected to examine the learner's actual conditions of cognition in science study, junior high school student's actual conditions, observations and experiments. The objective of this study was to examine the learner's actual conditions in science study. Within this framework, the following facts were established : 1 ) The male students prefer the science study of doing observations and experiment lessons, and worked harder in the study than female students. The female students tended to decide the like or dislike observations and experiments. 2 ) Female students tended to prefer the science study of doing observations. It is evident that the female students like observation and experiment themes and learning units. 3 ) Both male and female students dislike learning the unit of electric current and magnetic field at second year and the unit of ion at third year. 4 ) There are differences between male and female students towards aim and forwardness of doing observations and experiments ; reliability of results about them in science study. For instance, the male students display a greater understanding of, and ability to perform the basic skills of observations and experiments than female students. 5 ) Almost all student appreciates the merit of doing hands-on classes and are concerned with learning contents of observations and experiments. But there is a difference between male student's viewpoints of tendency, and female students' idea of the role of observations and experiments. Female students place importance on learning contents and associate the form of learning with a particular role.
description.en: We have argued with regard to the role of observations and experiments in science study in terms of utility, limits, and so on. In general, we recognize the importance of observations and experiments in science study. Until now, we have neglected to examine the learner's actual conditions of cognition in science study, junior high school student's actual conditions, observations and experiments. The objective of this study was to examine the learner's actual conditions in science study. Within this framework, the following facts were established : 1 ) The male students prefer the science study of doing observations and experiment lessons, and worked harder in the study than female students. The female students tended to decide the like or dislike observations and experiments. 2 ) Female students tended to prefer the science study of doing observations. It is evident that the female students like observation and experiment themes and learning units. 3 ) Both male and female students dislike learning the unit of electric current and magnetic field at second year and the unit of ion at third year. 4 ) There are differences between male and female students towards aim and forwardness of doing observations and experiments ; reliability of results about them in science study. For instance, the male students display a greater understanding of, and ability to perform the basic skills of observations and experiments than female students. 5 ) Almost all student appreciates the merit of doing hands-on classes and are concerned with learning contents of observations and experiments. But there is a difference between male student's viewpoints of tendency, and female students' idea of the role of observations and experiments. Female students place importance on learning contents and associate the form of learning with a particular role.

paper_title.ja: 科学概念の形成に総合的調和の方法を取り入れた指導方法についての実践的研究
電磁気学の概念形成を支援するための指導方略に関する実践的研究
paper_title.en: A study of the teaching strategy for assisting students to form scientific conceptions in the field of electromagnetism : Through the methods of enriching children's background and using the method of restructurization

description.ja: It has been proposed that children's preconceptions can influence their progress in the initial stages of learning electrical concepts in the context of electric circuits. But little is known about the ideas children have about electric circuits beyond these early steps and how to utilize children's ideas to teach them these scientific concepts. The purpose of this study was to investigate the children's comprehension after being taught by conventional instruction, and to propose a new teaching strategy. For this purpose, we conducted research and instruction on a third grade class, lower secondary school. The following results were obtained: (1) On the learning of electric circuits, the children made superficial progress in learning to calculate the intensity of electric currents, voltage and electrical resistance by using scientific laws; at the same time, the children developed a "traffic flow model" of electric circuits. It is not easy to exchange their traffic flow model with the scientific model. (2) To exchange their traffic model with the scientific model, it is useful to use a two step teaching approach: First to enrich the children's knowledge and, second to use "the method of restructurization" that restructures those ideas learned in the first step.
description.en: It has been proposed that children's preconceptions can influence their progress in the initial stages of learning electrical concepts in the context of electric circuits. But little is known about the ideas children have about electric circuits beyond these early steps and how to utilize children's ideas to teach them these scientific concepts. The purpose of this study was to investigate the children's comprehension after being taught by conventional instruction, and to propose a new teaching strategy. For this purpose, we conducted research and instruction on a third grade class, lower secondary school. The following results were obtained: (1) On the learning of electric circuits, the children made superficial progress in learning to calculate the intensity of electric currents, voltage and electrical resistance by using scientific laws; at the same time, the children developed a "traffic flow model" of electric circuits. It is not easy to exchange their traffic flow model with the scientific model. (2) To exchange their traffic model with the scientific model, it is useful to use a two step teaching approach: First to enrich the children's knowledge and, second to use "the method of restructurization" that restructures those ideas learned in the first step.

paper_title.ja: アメリカの環境教育に見られる価値の枠組みについての研究
paper_title.en: The study of values in American environmental education

description.ja: We examined the values taught in environmental education of the United States.We believe that two types of values are found in environmental education.One deals with relationships between people, while the other deals with relationships between people and nature.The former is classified into three types, that is a.environmental equity between the current generation and future generations b.environmental equity within the current generation c.equality between cultures The latter is classified into three types, that is a.global and sustainable management of natural resources(the anthropocentric view)b.environmental sensitivity c.The role of humans as equal members of the biotic community(the encocentric view) At present, the anthropocentric view is the dominant perspective in environmental education.
description.en: We examined the values taught in environmental education of the United States.We believe that two types of values are found in environmental education.One deals with relationships between people, while the other deals with relationships between people and nature.The former is classified into three types, that is a.environmental equity between the current generation and future generations b.environmental equity within the current generation c.equality between cultures The latter is classified into three types, that is a.global and sustainable management of natural resources(the anthropocentric view)b.environmental sensitivity c.The role of humans as equal members of the biotic community(the encocentric view) At present, the anthropocentric view is the dominant perspective in environmental education.

paper_title.ja: フランスにおける初等理科の改革と現行教科書からみた特徴
paper_title.en: The reform of elementary school science in France and its characteristics as seen from textbooks

description.ja: The science education curriculum in France began to change after greatly 1970. This paper points out that through "sciences et technologie" in 1985 science education was started from the lower grades of primay school in France, goes on to explain the characteristics of that reform, and considers the characteristics of the recent science education reform. As for the characteristics of French science education, by comparing science textbooks with courses of study, the emphasis on the acquisition of fundamental knowledge, is demonstrated.
description.en: The science education curriculum in France began to change after greatly 1970. This paper points out that through "sciences et technologie" in 1985 science education was started from the lower grades of primay school in France, goes on to explain the characteristics of that reform, and considers the characteristics of the recent science education reform. As for the characteristics of French science education, by comparing science textbooks with courses of study, the emphasis on the acquisition of fundamental knowledge, is demonstrated.

paper_title.ja: 80年代後半以降のアメリカの初等・中等教育にみられる環境リテラシーの研究
paper_title.en: A Study of Environmental Literacy in Elementary and Secondary Education in the United States of Ameirca since the late 1980 ies : With a Focus on Knowledge Strands

description.ja: This paper examines the content of environmental literacy in elementary and secondary education in the United States of America with a focus on knowledge stands. An examination of the advanced-level framework or curriculum guides in environmental education shows that we can classify know ledge into eight domains, namely; knowledge of biology, geology and meteorology, energy, natural resources, relation between man and nature, relation between environment and pokitics, environmental problems, and relation between culture, values and nature. These areas of knowledge have great variety, with an emphasis on ethics. We conclude with a discussion of multiculturalism in environmental education and look at approaches to integrating environmental education into elementary and secondary education.
description.en: This paper examines the content of environmental literacy in elementary and secondary education in the United States of America with a focus on knowledge stands. An examination of the advanced-level framework or curriculum guides in environmental education shows that we can classify know ledge into eight domains, namely; knowledge of biology, geology and meteorology, energy, natural resources, relation between man and nature, relation between environment and pokitics, environmental problems, and relation between culture, values and nature. These areas of knowledge have great variety, with an emphasis on ethics. We conclude with a discussion of multiculturalism in environmental education and look at approaches to integrating environmental education into elementary and secondary education.

paper_title.ja: アメリカの州レベルにおける環境教育行政の動向
paper_title.en: Trends in state-level policy on environmental education in the United States

description.ja: This paper examined the trends in state-level policy on environmental education in the United States. In the 70's, environmental education policy made great progress. But in the first half of the 80's, environmental education policy has declined rapidly. We think this decline is result of incomplete integration of environmental education into the educational system. In the latter half of the 80's and 90's, environmental education policy has been revived. This revival waw activated by grass-roots activity by environmental education advocates and was accelerated by the National Environmental Education Act. At present, environmental education has a chance to take part in educational reform and be successfully integrated into the educational system. Wisconsin, Arizona and Florida are states with advanced environmental education policy. For example, Arizona has a fine and comprehensive state plan for environmental education. Wisconsin has an environmental education center which supports state-wide in-service teacher education and environmental education assessment. Florida has a network of state agencies for environmental education and environmental education trust funds. The above cases are taken up in this paper.
description.en: This paper examined the trends in state-level policy on environmental education in the United States. In the 70's, environmental education policy made great progress. But in the first half of the 80's, environmental education policy has declined rapidly. We think this decline is result of incomplete integration of environmental education into the educational system. In the latter half of the 80's and 90's, environmental education policy has been revived. This revival waw activated by grass-roots activity by environmental education advocates and was accelerated by the National Environmental Education Act. At present, environmental education has a chance to take part in educational reform and be successfully integrated into the educational system. Wisconsin, Arizona and Florida are states with advanced environmental education policy. For example, Arizona has a fine and comprehensive state plan for environmental education. Wisconsin has an environmental education center which supports state-wide in-service teacher education and environmental education assessment. Florida has a network of state agencies for environmental education and environmental education trust funds. The above cases are taken up in this paper.
